radiographic_examinations.findings: Several calculi are identified within the lumen of the gallbladder, the largest measuring 1.0 cm x 0.9 cm. A 1.0 cm x 1.2 cm calculus is seen impacted within the gallbladder neck/cystic duct. Mild generalized mural thickening of the gallbladder wall is present. Small amount of pericholecystic fluid and stranding is identified. The common bile duct is normal in caliber; no intraluminal filling defects to suggest choledocholithiasis. A small amount of free fluid is seen in the perihepatic and perisplenic areas. The liver shows heterogeneous enhancement on arterial phase imaging, resolving on portal venous phase. A tiny cortical cyst is identified at the mid pole of the left kidney measuring 0.6 cm x 0.5 cm. No other focal lesion is seen in the left kidney; the right kidney is normal. The adrenal glands and major blood vessels are normal.
